reviewText: Lest WE FORGET in these times when so many act without feeling or fear of repudiation ~ WE who lived through that WAR owe remembrance to all of our Black, Native American, and Hispanic members who served in every WAR to SECURE OUR LIVES, LIBERTIES and HAPPINESS so that this Nation would endure.  Privileged entitlement without service to this Nation is an embarrassment to every member of OUR SOCIETY who did serve and should be noted as well!
Title: Wereth Eleven, The

reviewText: I was not familiar with this event and it was sad what took place as so many things that happened in WW II. It was good to tell their story and involve their families to share the experience.
Title: Wereth Eleven, The

reviewText: CREATIVE AMERICANISM AT ITS BEST.  THOUSANDS OF SOLDIERS LIVED BECAUSE OF THE CREATIVITY OF ARTISTS AND SCIENTISTS.  A GREAT LEARNING EXPERIENCE FOR THE VIEWER.  A TRUE FIVE STAR PRESENTATION.
Title: Wereth Eleven, The

reviewText: Well narrated and scripted docudrama that presents an accurate description of the brutal massacre of eleven soldiers at Wereth, Belgium, during the German Ardennes Offensive in December 1944.  The 333rd Field Artillery was one of the all Black units that fought during WWII . . . this is a part of their history. Interviews and original footage is included.Accused at the Nuremberg Trials included Joachim Peiper. He gave his SS unit a 'no prisoners' order that allowed for the Malmedy and Wereth massacres as well as the massacre of Belgium civilians in the same area (original footage).Definitely recommended. WWII history buff or student of Black History, this includes the importance and contributions of the all Black units . . . well worth the time![Smooth streaming and crisp audio]
Title: Wereth Eleven, The

reviewText: As a historry buff I watch The History Channel and read many books by and about people you never heard about.  I am still amazed by the number of those stories and can't help but wonder how many such stories will never be told.  The Wereth Eleven is the story of 8 black artillery soldiers executed by the Germans in WWII, perhaps murdered would be a more appropiate word, as told by people who were there, archival footage, and sons of two of dead soldiers.
Title: Wereth Eleven, The

reviewText: it was quite interesting and it was about time that African American WW II  veterans get  some recognition for their war effort and sacrifices.
Title: Wereth Eleven, The

reviewText: Excellent documentary. The Wereth Eleven is well filmed and tells the true story of 11 African American soldiers who suffered at the hands of Nazi war criminals, during one of the most significant events in history.
Title: Wereth Eleven, The

reviewText: I can't add anything to all the reviews, but I wanted to add my vote to the 5-star reviews. A very emotional movie.

reviewText: My husband watched this and enjoyed the history of the situation. It showed how hard it was for the black soldiers at the time...wheteher it was with our army or the enemy!
Title: Wereth Eleven, The

reviewText: Well intentioned documentary, presented with genuine love, and most of the re-enacting and editing are certainly up to par. The narration could have been better and writing is just okay.  Worth watching just to learn about a lost chapter in WW 2 history.
Title: Wereth Eleven, The

reviewText: That is the only way I know to put it is bad. Bad acting, bad and cheap production, bad everything.
Title: Wereth Eleven, The

reviewText: This is the story of the 333rd Field Artillery Battalion -- and in a round about manner -- the 11 of the battalion's POWs who escaped, that were betrayed by a Nazi sympathizer in Wereth, tortured (some had their fingers cut off) and brutally murdered by the SS...and all before Christmas. :(It was worse than a lynching.The barbarity of their demise is why their memory should never be forgotten, lest we forget. Unlike the 84 US soldiers who were also murdered at Malmedy the same day, these men didn't receive their justice via a court of law.SSG Thomas J. ForteT/4 William Edward PritchettT/4 James A. StewartCPL Mager BradleyPFC George DavisPFC James L. LeatherwoodPFC George W. MotenPFC Due W. TurnerPVT Curtis AdamsPVT Robert GreenPVT Nathanial MossThey made the ultimate sacrifice not only for their country, for their people./salute
summary: Docudrama of the Masscre of the Wereth 11 on 12-17-1944
Title: Wereth Eleven, The

reviewText: Overall, I thought this was a pretty interesting documentary on The Wereth Eleven.  The combat cinematics that were reenacted were well done.  The only thing that brings this movie down was the fact that the reenacted fighting scenes were repeated a lot.  Other than that, the narration and flow of the movie was decent.
summary: Decent movie about an unknown group
Title: Wereth Eleven, The

reviewText: Unusual style for a documentary but in the end quite effective.  Really more of a tribute than just a documentary about events.
Title: Wereth Eleven, The

reviewText: I was not aware of this historic event from WW II.  It is nice to know this portion of history, as I use to be a WW II history buff.
